articles.title: BARMM recorded 46 mpox cases -MOH
articles.description: The Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao recorded a total of 46 cases of monkeypox as of June 8, 2025, according to the Ministry of Health.
articles.content:
The Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao recorded a total of 46 cases of monkeypox as of June 8, 2025, according to the Ministry of Health.
In a statement Tuesday, the MOH said of the 46 cases, eight were positive, 31 suspected, and seven ... [1233 chars]

articles.description: Announcing a new article publication for Zoonoses journal. Because varicella zoster virus (VZV) infections are continually increasing, vaccine efficacy must be enhanced.

articles.title: Measles immunity required for maids working in households with young kids not fully vaccinated
articles.description: This comes into effect from Sept 1. Read more at straitstimes.com.
articles.content:
Despite high vaccination coverage and population immunity in Singapore, the surge in measles cases globally and regionally continues to pose public health risks. PHOTO: AFP

articles.title: Mandatory measles immunity for maids working in households with young children who are not fully vaccinated
articles.description: The measure will come into effect from Sep 1.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE: From Sep 1, maids working in households with young children who are not fully vaccinated against measles must be immunised against the disease.

articles.title: Real reasons people do not have the number of children they want revealed in new report
articles.description: As right-wing governments seek to blame a rejection of parenthood, a survey reveals a lack of choice, not desire, stops people having the families they want
articles.content:
Millions of people are prevented from having the number of children they want by a toxic mix of economic barriers and sexism, a new UN report has warned.
Factors such as the high cost of parenthood, job insecurity, expensive housing, concerns over th... [3205 chars]

articles.title: What researchers found when they compared food labels in 17 countries
articles.description: New research uncovers how hyper-palatable foods saturate the US food supply and highlights urgent public health challenges posed by engineered foods worldwide.
articles.content: A global analysis of over 314,000 food items found that hyper-palatable foods, engineered to drive overeating, are widespread in the US and Europe, but especially prevalent in the US and Bulgaria. Countries like Italy and Germany offer healthier food... [7652 chars]

articles.title: Panthers dominate Oilers, chase Skinner in 6-1 Game 3 rout
articles.description: The Panthers seized control of what had been a tight Stanley Cup Finals after two games, dominating the discombobulated Oilers 6-1 in Game 3.
articles.content:
The Panthers rout the Oilers 6-1 in Game 3 to take a 2-1 series lead in the Stanley Cup Final. (2:35)

articles.description: The Philippines and the United States once again reaffirmed their strong alliance as the foundation of peace and stability in the Indo-Pacific, along with a commitment to further expand security and economic cooperation amid China’s increasing assertiveness in the South China Sea.

articles.title: Explained: Why scientists study tardigrades, tiny eight-legged ‘water bears’, in space
articles.description: Tardigrades have been a part of space missions since 2007, when some 3,000 moss piglets hitched a ride to space aboard the European Space Agency’s Foton-M3 mission
articles.content:
Among the scientific experiments astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla will undertake during his two week stay at the International Space Station (ISS) is one that will examine the revival, survival, and reproduction of tardigrades in space.
